body_html:
@bhack How do you get a handle to the output that is not used in loss when using model_to_estimator?
Here is what I have tried: https://gist.github.com/pavithrasv/2077a1e4be619cc000d573180b863ea3

In the above snippet, dense_1 is the output that is not being used in loss. But I do not have a way to get a handle to that output from the estimator instance.

As I have mentioned before it is difficult for us to be able to reproduce the issue without a code snippet. It would be great if you can share your code snippet.

Thank you!

body:
@bhack How do you get a handle to the output that is not used in loss when using model_to_estimator? 
Here is what I have tried: https://gist.github.com/pavithrasv/2077a1e4be619cc000d573180b863ea3

In the above snippet, `dense_1` is the output that is not being used in loss. But I do not have a way to get a handle to that output from the estimator instance. 

As I have mentioned before it is difficult for us to be able to reproduce the issue without a code snippet. It would be great if you can share your code snippet.

Thank you!
